business.headline: US Fed rate cut decision: How will it impact Indian stock markets? The Sensex declined over 1,100 points and the Nifty fell below 24,000 after the US Federal Reserve's decision to cut interest rates by 0.25% to 4.5%, coupled with a hawkish outlook on future rate adjustments.

Mamata Machinery IPO: Latest GMP sees sharp rise; should you subscribe?Mamata Machinery, a leading manufacturer of packaging machines, seeks to raise Rs 179.39 crore from its offer for sale, with promoters selling up to 73.82 lakh equity shares at a face value of Rs 10 each.
Explained: Why SpiceJet share price jumped nearly 8% todaySpicejet share price: The airline's share price was up 7.48% to Rs 60.49 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 12:40 pm.

PMAY-U 2.0: Who can apply for affordable homes under Pradhan Mantri Awas YojanaPradhan Mantri Awas Yojana Urban 2.0 aims to provide affordable housing to one crore urban families, focusing on inclusive development through various housing schemes and subsidies.

Explained: Why Sensex fell over 1,000 points today and will bloodbath continue? Sensex and Nifty extended their losing streak as global markets plunged after the US Fed's cautious rate cut signal. Will the bears tighten their grip on Dalal Street, or is a reversal in sight?

Sanathan Textiles IPO opens for bidding: Check issue size, price band, latest GMPSanathan Textiles' Rs 550 crore IPO offers investment opportunities in a leading yarn manufacturer, with proceeds directed towards debt repayment and growth initiatives.

Inventurus Knowledge Solutions IPO share listing: Stocks list at 43% premium Inventurus Knowledge Solutions IPO share price: On the NSE, the shares opened at Rs 1,900 per share, marking a premium of 42.96% over the issue price.
Rupee plunges to all-time low, reaches Rs 85 against US dollar Rupee falls to all-time low: The rupee dropped to 85.0650 against the US dollar in early trade, compared to 84.9525 on Wednesday.

Dalal Street bloodbath: 3 reasons behind today's stock market crashStock market crash: Sensex dropped over 1,000 points while Nifty fell below 24,000, marking the fourth consecutive day of losses for the benchmark indices.

Wall Street jitters: Sensex crashes, Nifty tumbles over US Fed rate cutStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 925.21 points to 79,256.69, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 309.75 points to 23,889.10.

Transrail Lighting IPO: All you need to know. Check GMP before subscribing Transrail Lighting Limited, established in February 2008, is an engineering and construction company specialising in power transmission and distribution.

US Fed cuts key interest rates by 0.25%: 3 key takeaways for stock marketsThe Fed's decision, along with its forecast of fewer rate cuts in 2025, rattled investors across the globe, leading to widespread sell-offs in equities.
Will 2025 bring a bull run? Key trends for Nifty to watchICICI Securities projects a 20% rise in Nifty for 2025, driven by historical trends, sectoral strength, and strategic stock picks.
Rama Mohan Rao Amara appointed as SBI's new managing director: ReportThe decision was made by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC), which is headed by the Prime Minister.

Own foreign assets or income? Disclose now to avoid Rs 10 lakh penaltyTaxpayers must disclose foreign income and assets by December 31, 2024, to avoid hefty penalties under the Income Tax and Black Money Acts.

Sensex, Nifty stumble: Will 2024 end with stock markets in red?Sensex, Nifty stumble: The market has been under pressure for three consecutive days, with the Sensex losing 1,951 points during this period.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as US trade and Fed jitters spook investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 502.25 points to end at 80,182.20, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 137.15 points to close the day at 24,198.85.

Va Tech Wabag shares: Why VA Tech Wabag stocks are in focus?As of 2:50 PM, the shares were trading at Rs 1,655.15, down 12.20% from the previous close. Earlier in the day, the stock dropped to Rs 1,586.50 on the NSE, marking a 15.8% decline.
NMDC share price falls over 6% today. Here's whyShares of NMDC and steel firms fell as Karnataka proposed a mining tax bill, impacting iron ore costs and profitability across the sector.
Rs 880 crore unclaimed: Is your LIC policy among them? Here's how to checkOver Rs 880 crore in LIC maturity benefits remain unclaimed by nearly 3.72 lakh policyholders in FY24.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 'Felt uncomfortable as lady: BJP MP says Rahul Gandhi stood close, shouted at herA woman MP alleged that Rahul Gandhi misbehaved with her at Parliament during the protest and claimed the Congress leader's behaviour and close physical proximity made her feel extremely uncomfortable.

High drama outside Parliament as BJP, Congress trade claims on MPs being pushed  Live UpdatesTensions erupted outside Parliament on Thursday as BJP and Congress MPs traded accusations of assault during protests over Amit Shah's remarks on Dr BR Ambedkar. Both sides alleged physical confrontations.

New US visa appointment rules to cut wait time, bring relief for Indians in 2025The US Embassy in India has announced new regulations to reduce wait time and streamline the non-immigrant visa appointment process, starting January 1, 2025. Applicants can also reschedule their appointments once without paying additional fees. This comes amid the recent announcement of the H-1B visa system overhaul.

Ashwin was humiliated: Father Ravichandran says retirement 'shocked' familyR Ashwin's father said the timing of the off-spinner's retirement from international cricket came as a surprise to the family. Ravichandran added that he had hoped his son would continue playing for the senior national team.

Women are flowers, says Iran's Khamenei, Israel replies with a photo. But whose?Israel has a response to Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, who described women as "a delicate flower". The response features a photo of a woman dressed in all black with her head covered. Here's who she is and why Israel used her photo.

Knees injured: Mallikarjun Kharge claims BJP MPs pushed him during protestCongress Chief Mallikarjun Kharge alleged that BJP MPs pushed him, causing a knee injury, and termed it an attack on his roles as Congress President and Leader of the Opposition in Rajya Sabha, seeking an enquiry.

Mufasa The Lion King review: Visually stunning but a forgettable prequelMufasa: The Lion King movie review: Directed by Barry Jenkins, Mufasa: The Lion King is a prequel to the 1994-film The Lion King. The prequel lacks emotional gravtias.

Electricity supply cut at Sambhal riot-accused MP's house after power theft caseOfficials claim that evidence of tampering was found in two electricity meters at the house of Samajwadi Party's Sambhal MP, Zia ur Rehman Barq.

India is losing Bangladesh to China and Pakistan—And It could get worseHow Bangladesh's shift to China and Pakistan challenges India's influence and disrupts South Asia's fragile geopolitical balance.

Virat Kohli confronts Aussie journalist for photographing family at airportBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Batting star Virat Kohli had a heated argument with a reporter at the Melbourne airport. Kohli did not like the journalist clicking photos of his wife, Anushka Sharma, and their children.

Never seen such scenes: Rescuers describe chaos after Mumbai boat accidentThirteen people died, and 115 were rescued after a Navy speedboat rammed a passenger ferry near the Gate Way of India in Mumbai on Wednesday.
Kia Syros unveiled, compact SUV aims to take on bigger Creta, Hyryder, Elevate, GVSyros is Kia's second compact SUV for the Indian market.

End of road for Indians looking to enter US via Canada?In recent years, Indians entering illegally into the US preferred taking the Canada route over the Mexico one. That donkey route might now lead to a dead end as Canadian PM Justin Trudeau works to boost border security upon warning from US President-elect Donald Trump, who plans to crack down on illegal immigration.

Goa homestay owner slams guests for trashing property in just one night. VideoIn a detailed caption accompanying a video of the property, the owner explained what exactly happened after he rented his place for a night only.

Post-Syria, why Uyghur militant group's threat to China is India's worry tooA South Asia spillover of the Turkistan Islamic Party's planned offensive against China has grave implications for regional stability and Indian counterterrorism efforts

Learnt kung fu to beat up MPs? Minister's dig at Rahul Gandhi amid 'assault' rowUnion Minister of Parliamentary Affairs Kiren Rijiju criticised Rahul Gandhi over the scuffle outside Parliament, accusing him of shoving BJP MPs.

X user calls out Uber for shabby vehicles in viral post, company reactsIn a post on X, an Uber user expressed frustration over the poor condition of cabs in India. The company reacted to the now-viral post.

Why now (December) is a better time to start your New Year resolutionsAre you always excited about New Year's resolutions, only for the enthusiasm to fade away within a few days or weeks? Psychologists have an innovative solution to help you stick to your resolutions – start them in December.

Watch: Rahul Gandhi approaches injured BJP MP in Parliament, gets called outAmid a political row over BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi's injury, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was seen approaching the injured parliamentarian.

Sebastian Stan says Apprentice director was 'going to cast a woman to play Trump'Sebastian Stan revealed his struggles in preparing for the role of Donald Trump in The Apprentice. The actor discussed panic attacks, a prosthetics failure, and insights from director Ali Abbasi.

Nana Patekar invites Aamir Khan for a special screening of his film VanvaasNana Patekar is set to host a special Vanvaas screening for Aamir Khan. The film, starring Utkarsh Sharma and Simratt Kaur along with Nana Patekar, is set to release on December 20.

Kannada actor Upendra on working with Rajinikanth in Coolie: It was my dreamKannada actor Upendra, in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, talked about joining hands with Superstar Rajinikanth in Coolie. The film's shooting is progressing at a brisk pace.

BB 18 Day 72: Sara Arfeen Khan slaps herself amid fight with Edin and Kashish In the latest episode of Bigg Boss 18, Sara Arfeen Khan slapped herself during the Time God task. She questioned Edin Rose and Kashish Kapoor's friendship with her.

A relentless perfectionist and a cricket nut, Ashwin's legacy is as much about his craft on the field as it is about his analytical mind and willingness to challenge norms.

PSG's Donnarumma leaves field after boot to the face tackle vs MonacoGianluigi Donnarumma endured a frightening injury in PSG's 4-2 victory over Monaco after Wilfried Singo's high boot struck his face. Despite the setback, PSG extended their Ligue 1 lead, though their Champions League struggles remain concerning.

Vinicius, Mbappe, Rodrygo score as Real Madrid lift Intercontinental CupReal Madrid defeated Pachuca 3-0 in the 2024 Intercontinental Cup final, with Mbappe, Rodrygo, and Vinicius Jr delivering stellar performances to secure their second trophy of the season after a dominant display against the Liga MX side.

Underestimated intensity of world championship, was not at my best: GukeshChess world champion D Gukesh has explained the reason behind not being at his best in the World Championship against Ding Liren. Gukesh said that he underestimated the intensity of the tournament.

Why Gabba draw vs India is bad news for AustraliaAUS vs IND: Australia have plenty to look forward to after not being able to secure a win in the Gabba Test against India. Pat Cummins and Co. will have their task cut out when the Boxing Day Test starts on December 26.

Ashwin ended his career as India's 2nd highest wicket-taker in Tests after Kumble.

Hunt for WTC Final begins as South Africa announces Test squad vs PakistanSouth Africa has announced its 16-man squad for the upcoming Test series against Pakistan, set to begin on December 26 in Centurion, with a clear focus on securing a place in next year's World Test Championship (WTC) final.

D Gukesh reveals how he plans to spend Rs 11.45 crore world championship prize Chess prodigy D Gukesh shares insight into the world champion's plan for the Rs 11.45 crore prize money. The 18-year-old's  parents made huge sacrifices in his journey to the top.

Coach Andrew Flintoff calls up son Rocky for England LionsEngland Lions head coach Andrew Flintoff has called-up his son Rocky for the team's tour of Australia. Rocky, who is 16, made his first class debut in 2024.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
